name: Palm Springs Visitor Center (Tramway Gas Station)
address: 2901 N Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: The Palm Springs Visitor Center, formerly the Tramway Gas Station is an iconic building with its distinctive soaring roof. Designed by Albert Frey and Robson Chambers.

name: Villa Alejo Condominiums
address: 277 E Alejo Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: A significant example of mid-century modern condominium design in Palm Springs.

name: Oasis Commercial Building
address: 101 S Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: An early example of desert modernism in downtown Palm Springs.

name: Ship of the Desert
address: 299 W Carmino Carmelita, Palm Springs, CA 92264
description: An early modernist house with distinctive nautical-inspired design elements.

name: Edris House
address: 1030 W Cielo Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: A masterful example of desert modernism by E. Stewart Williams.

name: Fire Station No. 1
address: 277 N Indian Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: A functional yet stylish fire station designed by Albert Frey and Robson Chambers.

name: Steel Development Houses
address: 300 E Molino Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: The Steel Development Houses showcase innovative prefabricated steel construction methods pioneered by Donald Wexler.

name: Kaufmann Desert House
address: 470 W Vista Chino, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: One of the most important examples of International Style architecture in the Americas.

name: Elvis Honeymoon Hideaway (Alexander Estate)
address: 1350 Ladera Cir, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: Also known as the House of Tomorrow, where Elvis and Priscilla Presley spent their honeymoon.

name: Palm Springs Art Museum (and Frey House II)
address: 101 Museum Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: A prime example of desert modernism by E. Stewart Williams. The Frey House II (1963 by Albert Frey)is owned by the Museum and is inaccessible as it is located on a private road, however tours can be arranged through the Museum.

name: Bank of America Building
address: 588 S Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92264
description: One of the finest examples of mid-century modern bank design.

name: Palm Springs City Hall
architect: Albert Frey, E. Stewart Williams, Robson Chambers, John Porter Clark
address: 3200 E Tahquitz Canyon Way, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: Features Albert Frey's distinctive design elements including the iconic brise-soleil.

name: Racquet Club Estates
address: 2744 N Via Miraleste, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: A neighborhood of Alexander Construction Company homes featuring butterfly roofs and innovative desert modern design.

name: Del Marcos Hotel
address: 225 W Baristo Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: One of William F. Cody's earliest and most significant works in Palm Springs.

name: Kocher-Samson Building
address: 766 N Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: An early example of International Style architecture in Palm Springs, designed by Albert Frey and A. Lawrence Kocher.

name: Aluminaire House
address: 500 W Museum Way, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: A groundbreaking example of modern architecture, this all-metal prefabricated house was originally built in 1931 and relocated to Palm Springs. It represents one of the first examples of International Style architecture in the United States.

name: Coachella Valley Savings & Loan #2 (Chase Bank)
address: 499 S Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: Originally built as the second Coachella Valley Savings & Loan, this modernist bank building exemplifies E. Stewart Williams' innovative approach to commercial architecture. Now operating as a Chase Bank branch, it maintains its distinctive mid-century modern design features.

name: Kaptur Plaza
address: 650 E Tahquitz Canyon Way, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: A striking example of late modernist commercial architecture, featuring dramatic angular forms and deep-set windows characteristic of Hugh Kaptur's distinctive architectural style.

name: Village Manor (Orbit In)
address: 562 W Arenas Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: A classic example of mid-century modern hotel design by Herbert Burns, featuring distinctive architectural elements and period furnishings that capture the essence of Palm Springs' modernist era.

name: Fire Station No. 3
address: 590 E Racquet Club Rd, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: A modernist fire station designed by Hugh Kaptur, showcasing his distinctive approach to civic architecture.

name: Fire Station No. 4
address: 1300 S La Verne Way, Palm Springs, CA 92264
description: A modernist fire station designed by Hugh Kaptur, demonstrating his innovative approach to civic architecture.

name: Musicland Hotel
address: 1342 S Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92264
description: A distinctive mid-century modern hotel designed by Hugh Kaptur, featuring his characteristic bold architectural style.

name: Southern California Gas Company Building
address: 1800 E Tahquitz Canyon Way, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: A prime example of desert modernism in commercial architecture, featuring a distinctive folded-plate roof, deep overhangs for sun protection, and a seamless integration with its desert environment. The building's innovative design by Victor Gruen Associates effectively combines functionality with modernist aesthetics.

name: Palm Springs Art Museum Architecture and Design Center
address: 300 S Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: Originally designed as a bank, this International Style building now serves as the Architecture and Design Center for the Palm Springs Art Museum. The building exemplifies Williams' masterful blend of modernism with desert environment.

name: The Alley
address: 333 S Palm Canyon Dr, Palm Springs, CA 92262
description: Originally a Robinson's department store, this modernist building features distinctive brise soleil screens and was designed by the renowned firm of Pereira & Luckman. Now known as The Alley, it remains an excellent example of mid-century retail architecture.
